alert.note: Alert for Espanola Valley; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Jemez Mountains; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Santa Fe Metro Area; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 17 at 4:44AM MST until February 17 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 5 and 9 inches. Lesser amounts between 3-5 inches across the Santa Fe Metro and near Raton Pass. * WHERE...Sandia and Manzano Mountains including Edgewood, Jemez Mountains, Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass, Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Espanola Valley, Santa Fe Metro Area, and Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could become difficult. Slippery road conditions and periods of heavy snow will impact the morning commute in Santa Fe. Increase the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you for safety.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Espanola Valley; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Jemez Mountains; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Santa Fe Metro Area; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains
